I thought the subject was enough info, my apologies. its a rover that breaks down into 3 separate vehicles. my problem is i cant get it into orbit, i also need to design a lander for these. any rocket i attach these to is highly unstable with mechjeb. regardless of the components involved. the wings are not there for launch. its a recon drone thats meant to fly on its own.

To put it lightly, you're putting the horse before the carriage. Then putting another carriage on the horse and then attaching mini carriages to the horses legs. This craft of yours is unreasonably complex. Break it down into individual missions.
Another tip. It's best to keep all payloads in a single line, an axis that follows the center of your launch vehicle. You want to keep the center of mass of each part... centered.

Actually the center of mass is centered. I was quite surprised when I loaded it.

But as the other said you should keep your payload simpler. There are a few problems :

- The wings on one side of the pay load. As soon as the rocket starts turning you'll get large forces making the rocket turn even more => looping. You can avoid this by turning slower.

- you need to use struts to avoid oscillation. Put struts between the 3 parts of the ship. They ll cut themselves when you undock / separate them.

- your engines thrust into other part => this negate their thrust. Don't have your engines pointed at other part (like your recon plane tail)

As for MJ flying it : first make sure you have a probe part pointing up before staring the ascend AP (the navball must be fully blue).

Make sure the payload don't swing or you'll get in an growing oscillation and MJ won't control much at that point

You could try making the turn later and slower by toying with the ascent path editor, but you d start getting bad habit by doing it ...
